title: Whiteboard Friday - MozMoz logoMenu openMenu closeSearchMoz logo
description: Your all-in-one suite of SEO essentials.
content: By: Dr. Peter J. Meyers July 19, 2019 Aren't 301s, 302s, and Canonicals All Basically the Same? - Best of Whiteboard Friday Technical SEO | Whiteboard Friday | SEO Basics The answer is unequivocally no. In this fan-favorite Whiteboard Friday, Dr. Pete explains how bots and humans experience pages differently depending on which solution you use, why it matters, and how each choice is treated by Google. Read this post By: Britney Muller July 12, 2019 How to Target Featured Snippet Opportunities — Best of Whiteboard Friday Whiteboard Friday | Search Engines Once you've identified where the opportunity to nab a featured snippet lies, how do you go about targeting it? Read this post By: Benjamin Estes July 5, 2019 How to Make a Technical SEO Recommendation Technical SEO | Whiteboard Friday | SEO Consulting After you've put in the work with technical SEO and made your discoveries, there's one thing left to do: present your findings to the client and agree on next steps. Benjamin Estes presents his framework for making technical recommendations to clients and stakeholders to best position you for success. Read this post By: Serge Stefoglo June 28, 2019 How to Deliver JSON-LD Recommendations the Easy Way Technical SEO | Whiteboard Friday | E-Commerce SEO When you work with large clients whose sites comprise thousands (or hundreds of thousands) of pages, it's a daunting task to add the necessary markup. In today's Whiteboard Friday, we welcome Sergey Stefoglo to share his framework for delivering JSON-LD recommendations in a structured and straightforward way. Read this post By: Rand Fishkin June 21, 2019 The Easiest PR-Focused Link Building Tip in the Book Link Building | Whiteboard Friday | Public Relations Focused on new link acquisition for your clients or company? Link building is always a slog, but Rand has a PR-focused tip that makes it much easier to find people and publications that'll cover and amplify you. Check it out in this week's edition of Whiteboard Friday! Read this post By: Benjamin Estes June 14, 2019 How to Strategically Think About Technical SEO Technical SEO | Whiteboard Friday Have you considered that the way you think about technical SEO could be hindering or helping your success? Ben Estes shares his agency's tried-and-true framework for tackling technical SEO quandaries strategically. Read this post By: Cyrus Shepard June 7, 2019 7 Epic SEO Title Tag Hacks for Increased Rankings + Traffic - Best of Whiteboard Friday On-page SEO | Whiteboard Friday | Advanced SEO Title tags can have a huge impact on your click-through rates when optimized correctly. In this Whiteboard Friday, Cyrus shares how to use numbers, dates, questions, top referring keywords, and more to boost your CTR, traffic, and rankings. Read this post By: Rand Fishkin May 31, 2019 How to Make Money with SEO in 2019 SEO Consulting | Whiteboard Friday Sketchy, manipulative practices and simple, straightforward tweaks no longer do the job — to be successful in 2019, you need to be smart, strategic, and in tune with what searchers want. Rand Fishkin outlines three steps you need to have down if your goal is to improve your bottom line with the help of SEO. Read this post By: Dana DiTomaso May 24, 2019 What Your Google Tag Manager Container Should Contain SEO Analytics | Whiteboard Friday | SEO Tools Agencies, are you set up for ongoing Google Tag Manager success? Make your future self happier and more productive by setting up your GTM containers the right way now. Dana DiTomaso shares more tips and hints in this edition of Whiteboard Friday. Read this post By: Sam Marsden May 10, 2019 Visualizing Speed Metrics to Improve SEO, UX, & Revenue Technical SEO | Whiteboard Friday | User Experience (UX) With increasing benefits to SEO, UX, and customer loyalty that inevitably translates to revenue, there are more reasons than ever to both focus on site speed and become adept at communicating its value to devs and stakeholders. Sam Marsden takes us point-by-point through how Google understands speed metrics, the best ways to access and visualize that data, and why it all matters. Read this post By: Cyrus Shepard April 26, 2019 What Links to Target with Google's Disavow Tool - Whiteboard Friday Link Building | Whiteboard Friday Do you need to disavow links in the modern age of Google? Is it safe? If so, which links should you disavow? In this Whiteboard Friday, Cyrus Shepard answers all these questions and more. Read this post By: Cyrus Shepard March 8, 2019 How to Use Domain Authority 2.0 for SEO Link Building | Whiteboard Friday | SEO Tools Domain Authority is a well-known metric throughout the SEO industry, but what exactly is the right way to use it? In this Whiteboard Friday, Cyrus Shepard explains what's new with the new Domain Authority 2.0 update and how to best harness its power for your own SEO success. Read this post By: Kameron Jenkins March 1, 2019 7 Red Flags to Watch Out For When Auditing Your Link Profile - Whiteboard Friday Link Building | Whiteboard Friday | Advanced SEO From irrelevant, off-topic backlinks to cookie-cutter anchor text, there are more than a few clues hidden in your backlink profile that something spammy is going on. In this week's Whiteboard Friday, Kameron Jenkins shares her best advice from years working with clients on what to watch out for in a link profile audit. Read this post By: Will Critchlow February 22, 2019 What a Two-Tiered SERP Means for Content Strategy Content Marketing | Search Engines | Whiteboard Friday If you're a big site competing to rank for popular head terms, where's the best place to focus your content strategy? According to a hypothesis by the good folks at Distilled, the answer may lie in perfectly satisfying searcher intent. Read this post
